intro: Azorina vidalii, commonly known as the Vidal's azorina, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the Canary Islands. It is a small, mat-forming succulent that belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its adaptations to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, blue-green leaves and produces yellow flowers with five petals. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
